workflow.name: Automate cross-project dependency tracking between Jira and Monday
workflow.description:
## Description
Keep your product and project teams perfectly aligned by automatically syncing task dependencies between Jira and Monday.com. This workflow ensures real-time visibility into cross-platform blockers and dependencies, allowing smoother delivery across multiple teams and tools. üîÑüìÖüíº

## What This Template Does
- Step 1: Trigger the workflow on a schedule or manual run.
- Step 2: Fetch project tasks and dependencies from Jira.
- Step 3: Retrieve matching items from Monday.com based on linked project IDs or issue keys.
- Step 4: Compare dependencies between both systems.
- Step 5: Identify mismatched or missing dependencies across platforms.
- Step 6: Send summarized reports to Slack or Gmail for team visibility.
- Step 7: Optionally update Monday.com or Jira items with dependency status tags.

## Key Benefits
‚úÖ Maintain alignment across multiple projects and teams.
 ‚úÖ Detect and resolve dependency conflicts before they cause delays.
 ‚úÖ Automate visibility ‚Äî no more manual cross-checking.
 ‚úÖ Simplify multi-tool management for product and engineering leads.

## Features
- Integration between Jira Cloud and Monday.com API
- Cross-dependency comparison logic
- Scheduled or manual execution
- Slack/Gmail notifications for updates or conflicts
- Custom mapping for project and issue identifiers

## Requirements
- Jira Cloud account with API credentials
- Monday.com API key or OAuth2 token
- Optional: Slack or Gmail credentials for notifications
- n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted)

## Target Audience
- Product and Project Managers coordinating across tools üß©
- Engineering Leads overseeing multi-platform sprints ‚öôÔ∏è
- PMOs managing dependencies across cross-functional teams üìä
- Operations teams aiming for unified delivery visibility üìà

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
- Connect your Jira and Monday.com credentials in n8n.
- Map project identifiers or keys between Jira and Monday.com.
- (Optional) Configure Slack or Gmail for daily status alerts.
- Adjust the cron expression to match your monitoring schedule.
- Run the workflow once manually to validate mappings.
- Activate the workflow for ongoing dependency tracking. ‚úÖ

workflow.name: Automate Cross-Project Dependency Tracking between Jira and Monday.com

parameters.content:
## üéØ Workflow Overview

This automation monitors Jira project dependencies and proactively alerts teams about blocking issues that could delay project delivery.

**What it does:**
- Runs nightly to scan all open Jira issues
- Identifies blocking dependencies and calculates risk scores
- Creates coordination tasks for high-impact blockers
- Sends formatted email reports and Slack notifications
- Syncs critical items to Monday.com boards

**Use Case:** Perfect for project managers tracking cross-team dependencies and preventing delivery delays.

**Required Setup:**
- Jira Software Cloud credentials
- Gmail OAuth2 credentials
- Slack workspace access
- Monday.com account
- Update project key in Fetch Jira Issues node

## ‚è∞ Scheduled Trigger

Runs daily at midnight (00:00) to generate fresh dependency reports.

**Configuration:**
- Default: Runs at 00:00:00 daily
- Customize timing in trigger settings
- Consider your team's timezone

## üìã Fetch Open Issues

**Setup Required:**
1. Update JQL query with your project key
2. Example: `project = MYPROJ AND statusCategory != Done`
3. Connect your Jira credentials

**What it fetches:**
- All non-completed issues
- Issue links and dependencies
- Assignee and due date info

## üîç Filter Dependencies

Only processes issues that have linked dependencies.

**Logic:**
- Checks if `issuelinks` field exists
- Passes issues with dependencies to next node
- Skips standalone issues

## üîó Extract Dependencies

Parses issue links to identify blocking relationships.

**Extracts:**
- Blocker/blocked relationships
- Linked issue details
- Status and priority info
- Assignee contact details

## üìä Risk Calculation

Calculates impact scores based on urgency and dependency type.

**Risk Levels:**
- **High:** < 7 days to due date
- **Medium:** 7-14 days
- **Low:** > 14 days

**Impact Score:** Weighted by blocker type and time remaining

## üìã Monday.com Sync

**Setup Required:**
1. Replace `YOUR_BOARD_ID` with your board ID
2. Update `groupId` if needed
3. Connect Monday.com credentials

**Creates:** New items for each dependency issue

## üìß Email Formatter

Generates beautiful HTML email reports with:
- Summary statistics
- Blocking issues table
- Blocked issues table
- Color-coded risk indicators

**No configuration needed** - automatically formats data

## üì¨ Gmail Sender

**Setup Required:**
1. Replace `YOUR_EMAIL@example.com` with recipient email
2. Connect Gmail OAuth2 credentials
3. Grant necessary permissions

**Sends:** Formatted HTML report to stakeholders

## üìù Create Jira Task

**Setup Required:**
1. Replace `YOUR_PROJECT_ID` with coordination project ID
2. Update issue type if needed
3. Uses same Jira credentials

**Creates:** Coordination tasks with risk details

## üí¨ Slack Alerts

**Setup Required:**
1. Replace `YOUR_CHANNEL_ID` with channel ID
2. Connect Slack API credentials
3. Ensure bot has channel permissions

**Posts:** Real-time alerts with emoji indicators

parameters.jsCode:
// HTML Email Formatter for Dependency Risk Report let data; if ($input.all().length > 0 && Array.isArray($input.all()[0].json)) { data = $input.all()[0].json; } else if ($input.all().length > 0 && $input.all()[0].json.data) { data = $input.all()[0].json.data; } else if (Array.isArray($input.all())) { data = $input.all().map(item => item.json); } else { data = $input.all(); } if (!Array.isArray(data)) { data = [data]; } function generateHTMLEmail(data) { const today = new Date().toLocaleDateString('en-US', { year: 'numeric', month: 'long', day: 'numeric' }); const blockingIssues = data.filter(item => item.dependencyType === 'blocks'); const blockedIssues = data.filter(item => item.dependencyType === 'is blocked by'); const blockingRows = blockingIssues.map(item => ` ${item.issueKey} ${item.summary} ${item.assignee} ${item.dueDate !== 'No due date' ? item.dueDate : '-'} ${item.daysTillDue !== 999 ? `${item.daysTillDue} days` : '-'} ${item.linkedIssueKey}
${item.linkedIssueSummary} ${item.riskFlag} ${item.impactScore} `).join(''); const blockedRows = blockedIssues.map(item => ` ${item.issueKey} ${item.summary} ${item.assignee} ${item.dueDate !== 'No due date' ? item.dueDate : '-'} ${item.daysTillDue !== 999 ? `${item.daysTillDue} days` : '-'} ${item.linkedIssueKey}
${item.linkedIssueSummary} ${item.riskFlag} ${item.impactScore} `).join(''); const htmlEmail = ` Issue Dependency Risk Report

üö® Issue Dependency Risk Report

Generated on ${today}

‚ö†Ô∏è Attention Required: This report identifies critical dependencies that may impact project timelines.

${blockingIssues.length}
Blocking Issues
${blockedIssues.length}
Blocked Issues
${data.filter(i => i.riskFlag === 'High').length}
High Risk Items

üî¥ Issues Blocking Others

${blockingRows || ''}
Issue Key Summary Assignee Due Date Days Left Blocking Risk Impact
No blocking issues found

üîí Issues Being Blocked

${blockedRows || ''}
Issue Key Summary Assignee Due Date Days Left Blocked By Risk Impact
No blocked issues found

This is an automated report generated by n8n workflow.

¬© 2025 Project Management System
`; return htmlEmail; } const htmlContent = generateHTMLEmail(data); return [{ json: { html: htmlContent, subject: `üö® Issue Dependency Risk Report - ${new Date().toLocaleDateString()}`, text: `Issue Dependency Risk Report generated on ${new Date().toLocaleDateString()}` } }];

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details: The Cron node uses Cron under the hood - a time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems. Use this node when you want to trigger workflows periodically, especially in more complex scenarios like "every Tuesday at 9 am" or "Weekdays".

data.details: The Function node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow. Unlike the Function Item node, this node does not operate on incoming node data per-item. Instead, you must iterate over multiple items of incoming data yourself. This can be useful if you're performing data transformation where you want to manipulate the number of items being outputted by the node (i.e. 1 item is inputted in with nested object, 10 items are outputted without any nested objects)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
